content.webTitle: Mark Selby revs up and leaves Ricky Walden in his wake

fields.headline: Mark Selby revs up and leaves Ricky Walden in his wake
fields.bodyText: Mark Selby, runner-up two years ago and seeded to meet Ronnie O'Sullivan in the semi-finals, survived a testing opening challenge in the World Championship by beating Ricky Walden, winner of September's Shanghai Masters and the most dangerous of the four debutants this year, 10-6. The last frame of their opening session was significant. Selby, right, won it from 0-60 with a 73 clearance to lead 6-3 overnight, made a 127 break in yesterday's opening frame and improved to 8-4 before Walden showed his quality with a run of 100. Selby, though, put himself four up with five to play with 117 and seized victory two frames later with his third century of the afternoon, 101. Clive Everton
